expiry.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the end of a period of time during which an official document can legally be used, or the end of a period of authority
expiry.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the formal expiry of the presidential term in September
Only seven minutes remained before the expiry of the noon deadline.
expiry.translation[1].definitions[0].def: when an official document, period of time, or right to buy shares, currency etc expires
expiry.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The sellersâ€™ right to repossess the goods did not arise until the expiry of the credit period.
